lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Traders say it is difficult to foresee the riyal market moving completely out of the region, partly because of local demand and partly because of what is seen as the Saudi Arabian Monetary Agency's (SAMA) desire to moderate internationalisation of the riyal and protect it from undue speculation.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: Bahrain Monetary Agency figures show regional currency deposits held by offshore banks, most in Saudi riyals, dropped to the equivalent of 12.2 billion dlrs at end-September 1986 from 13.4 billion at end-1985 and a 1983 peak of 15.0 billion.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The major market maker has traditionally been London-based consortium bank <Saudi International Bank> but the kingdom joint-venture <Saudi American Bank> (SAMBA) also upgraded its London operation to deposit taker status in mid-February.

lst.name: sentence
lst.str: The major market maker has traditionally been London-based consortium bank <Saudi International Bank> but the kingdom joint-venture Bank> (SAMBA) also upgraded its London operation to deposit taker status in mid-February.
